text:
I often find myself writing functions like this one to apply colors categorically to a vector

```function categorical_colors(items, levels, colors)
    length(levels) <= length(colors) || throw(ArgumentError("Only $(length(colors)) colors for $(length(levels)) levels"))
    colarray = similar(colors, length(items))
    
    colmap = Dict(l => colors[i] for (i,l) in enumerate(levels))
    for i in eachindex(items)
        colarray[i] = colmap[i]
    end
    return colarray
end```
I know this kind of thing can be accomplished with AlgebraOfGraphics, does it make sense to have it somewhere in AbstractPlotting itself?
